headline: Bonus Advice From Judge John Hodgman
abstract: If you repeatedly forget to grab one upon entering the store, how should your partner point this out to you?
lead_paragraph: Adam writes: When my girlfriend and I enter a grocery store, I often forget to grab a basket. She always asks me, ‘‘Did you want to get a basket?’’ I find this question condescending. Of course I want a basket. I just forgot. I have asked her to simply say, ‘‘Hey, grab a basket.’’ She thinks this is rude.
